intro: Burmannia aprica var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf burmannia, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its short stature and clustered inflorescences. The plant features striking, fleshy, reddish-orange flowers that are often borne on short, erect stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in botanical gardens.
